verses.kjv: And the men of Ephraim gathered themselves together, and went northward, and said unto Jephthah, Wherefore passedst thou over to fight against the children of Ammon, and didst not call us to go with thee? we will burn thine house upon thee with fire.
verses.web: The men of Ephraim were gathered together, and passed northward; and they said to Jephthah, “Why did you pass over to fight against the children of Ammon, and didn’t call us to go with you? We will burn your house around you with fire!”
verses.ct: The men of Ephraim mobilized and marched north. They confronted Jephthah, demanding, "Why did you cross over to fight the Ammonites without calling us to join you? We're going to burn your house down with you in it!"

verses.kjv: And Jephthah said unto them, I and my people were at great strife with the children of Ammon; and when I called you, ye delivered me not out of their hands.
verses.web: Jephthah said to them, “I and my people were at great strife with the children of Ammon; and when I called you, you didn’t save me out of their hand.
verses.ct: Jephthah answered them, "My people and I were in a bitter struggle with the Ammonites. I did call for your help, but you never came to rescue me."

verses.kjv: And when I saw that ye delivered me not, I put my life in my hands, and passed over against the children of Ammon, and the LORD delivered them into my hand: wherefore then are ye come up unto me this day, to fight against me?
verses.web: When I saw that you didn’t save me, I put my life in my hand, and passed over against the children of Ammon, and LORD delivered them into my hand. Why then have you come up to me today, to fight against me?”
verses.ct: "When I saw you weren't coming, I risked my own life and crossed over to fight the Ammonites — and the LORD handed them over to me. So why are you coming here now to pick a fight with me?"

verses.kjv: Then Jephthah gathered together all the men of Gilead, and fought with Ephraim: and the men of Gilead smote Ephraim, because they said, Ye Gileadites are fugitives of Ephraim among the Ephraimites, and among the Manassites.
verses.web: Then Jephthah gathered together all the men of Gilead, and fought with Ephraim. The men of Gilead struck Ephraim, because they said, “You are fugitives of Ephraim, you Gileadites, in the middle of Ephraim, and in the middle of Manasseh.”
verses.ct: Jephthah then gathered all the men of Gilead and went to war against Ephraim. The Gileadites defeated them, because the Ephraimites had insulted them by saying, "You Gileadites are nothing but runaway Ephraimites — nobodies living between Ephraim and Manasseh."

verses.kjv: And the Gileadites took the passages of Jordan before the Ephraimites: and it was so, that when those Ephraimites which were escaped said, Let me go over; that the men of Gilead said unto him, Art thou an Ephraimite? If he said, Nay;
verses.web: The Gileadites took the fords of the Jordan against the Ephraimites. Whenever a fugitive of Ephraim said, “Let me go over,” the men of Gilead said to him, “Are you an Ephraimite?” If he said, “No;”
verses.ct: The Gileadites seized the crossing points of the Jordan River to cut off the Ephraimites' escape. Whenever a fleeing Ephraimite would say, "Let me cross over," the men of Gilead would ask him, "Are you an Ephraimite?" If he said, "No,"

verses.kjv: Then said they unto him, Say now Shibboleth: and he said Sibboleth: for he could not frame to pronounce it right. Then they took him, and slew him at the passages of Jordan: and there fell at that time of the Ephraimites forty and two thousand.
verses.web: then they said to him, “Now say ‘Shibboleth;’ ” and he said “Sibboleth”; for he couldn’t manage to pronounce it correctly, then they seized him and killed him at the fords of the Jordan. At that time, forty-two thousand of Ephraim fell.
verses.ct: they would tell him, "Then say 'Shibboleth.'" But he would say "Sibboleth," because he couldn't pronounce it correctly. They would grab him and kill him right there at the river crossing. In all, 42,000 Ephraimites were killed during that conflict.

verses.kjv: And Jephthah judged Israel six years. Then died Jephthah the Gileadite, and was buried in one of the cities of Gilead.
verses.web: Jephthah judged Israel six years. Then Jephthah the Gileadite died, and was buried in the cities of Gilead.
verses.ct: Jephthah led Israel as judge for 6 years. Then Jephthah the Gileadite died and was buried in one of the cities of Gilead.

verses.kjv: And after him Ibzan of Bethlehem judged Israel.
verses.web: After him Ibzan of Bethlehem judged Israel.
verses.ct: After Jephthah, Ibzan of Bethlehem became judge over Israel.

verses.kjv: And he had thirty sons, and thirty daughters, whom he sent abroad, and took in thirty daughters from abroad for his sons. And he judged Israel seven years.
verses.web: He had thirty sons. He sent his thirty daughters outside his clan, and he brought in thirty daughters from outside his clan for his sons. He judged Israel seven years.
verses.ct: He had 30 sons and 30 daughters. He married his daughters off to men outside his clan and brought in 30 wives from outside his clan for his sons. He judged Israel for 7 years.

verses.kjv: Then died Ibzan, and was buried at Bethlehem.
verses.web: Ibzan died, and was buried at Bethlehem.
verses.ct: Ibzan died and was buried in Bethlehem.

verses.kjv: And after him Elon, a Zebulonite, judged Israel; and he judged Israel ten years.
verses.web: After him, Elon the Zebulunite judged Israel; and he judged Israel ten years.
verses.ct: After him, Elon from the tribe of Zebulun became judge over Israel. He led Israel for 10 years.

verses.kjv: And Elon the Zebulonite died, and was buried in Aijalon in the country of Zebulun.
verses.web: Elon the Zebulunite died, and was buried in Aijalon in the land of Zebulun.
verses.ct: Elon the Zebulunite died and was buried in Aijalon in the territory of Zebulun.

verses.kjv: And after him Abdon the son of Hillel, a Pirathonite, judged Israel.
verses.web: After him, Abdon the son of Hillel the Pirathonite judged Israel.
verses.ct: After him, Abdon son of Hillel, from Pirathon, became judge over Israel.

verses.kjv: And he had forty sons and thirty nephews, that rode on threescore and ten ass colts: and he judged Israel eight years.
verses.web: He had forty sons and thirty sons’ sons who rode on seventy donkey colts. He judged Israel eight years.
verses.ct: He had 40 sons and 30 grandsons, who rode on 70 donkey colts — a sign of his wealth and status. He judged Israel for 8 years.

verses.kjv: And Abdon the son of Hillel the Pirathonite died, and was buried in Pirathon in the land of Ephraim, in the mount of the Amalekites.
verses.web: Abdon the son of Hillel the Pirathonite died, and was buried in Pirathon in the land of Ephraim, in the hill country of the Amalekites.
verses.ct: Abdon son of Hillel the Pirathonite died and was buried in Pirathon, in the territory of Ephraim, in the hill country of the Amalekites.
